2020.title: A glimpse at my creative process
2020.description: I love to explore new tools and techniques for my data visualization workflow. In particular I love to connect thoughts from different domains to improve my workflow or create new things from them. For me, combining existing concepts to new ideas is my preferred form of creativity.

2019.title: Visualizing Communication Networks
2019.description: I'd like to close the year with something that I am particularly proud of: An interactive visualization to explore the evolvement of GitHub communication networks. Written with D3.js and Vue.js this personal project is the first major case where I used those two libraries to combine multiple charts and interactivity in a single view.

2019.title: Reusable Chart Components
2019.description: D3.js is a fascinating set of tools for interactive data visualization to which I have been coming back almost a thousand times since I first discovered it. However, it requires to fully specify each feature of the charts you want to build. Combine D3 with a frontend technology like Vue.js and start to make use of its endless capabilities in an efficient manner!

2019.title: Horizon Charts
2019.description: Welcome to the new Data Viz category on my blog. As data visualization and analysis has - next to photography - become one of my key interests, I am going to post everything that I come across and that relates to the topic here. So let's jump right in! First Episode: Spaghetti vs. horizon charts!

2019.title: Ratschläge
2019.description: Je näher das Durchschnittsalter in meinem Freundeskreis an die 30-Jahr-Marke heranrückt, desto öfters kommen wir auf Arbeit, Kinder und natürlich Hochzeiten zu sprechen. Ich merke dabei oft, dass sich junge Paare bei den Hochzeitsvorbereitungen schnell im Informationschaos von Hochzeitsmessen und 'Wedding-Ratgebern' im Internet verlieren ...
